data.title: Technical Analyst at DISNEY
data.meta_description: Learn more about applying for Technical Analyst at DISNEY
data.text:
On any given day at Disney Entertainment & ESPN Technology, we’re reimagining ways to create magical viewing experiences for the world’s most beloved stories while also redefining Disney’s media business for the future. Whether that’s evolving our streaming and digital products in new and immersive ways, powering worldwide advertising and distribution to improve flexibility and efficiency, or delivering Disney’s unmatched entertainment and sports content, every day is a moment to make a difference to partners and to hundreds of millions of people around the world!

Building the future of Disney’s media business: DE&E Technologists are designing and building the infrastructure that will power Disney’s media, advertising, and distribution businesses for years to come.

Reach & Scale: The products and platforms this group builds and operates delight millions of consumers every minute of every day – from Disney+ and Hulu, to ABC News and Entertainment, to ESPN and ESPN+, and much more.

Innovation: We develop and complete groundbreaking products and techniques that shape industry norms and enhance how audiences experience sports, entertainment & news.

Business Operations helps guide and articulate technology strategy and is responsible for centralized program and project management, portfolio management and capital allocation, global roadmap and process management, incident management and space and resource management. The Operational Analytics and Reporting Team is focused on communications and analytical reporting for Service & Support Operations, which provides 24x7 centralized support to engineering organizations for request management, incident intake, major incident management, problem & change management and operational readiness.

Job Summary:

The Technical Analyst on the Operational Analytics & Reporting Team will drive data-driven decision-making by providing in-depth analysis, actionable insights and advanced reporting solutions. This role requires strong technical expertise in data analysis, proficiency in data visualization tools, and the ability to collaborate across departments to enhance operational efficiency and performance.

You’ll be instrumental in enhancing the organization's data capabilities, improving communication and collaboration, and driving projects that align with the company’s strategic vision, ultimately contributing to the organization's growth and success. If you’re the kind of person who obsesses over details, thrives in a collaborative environment, and jumps at the opportunity to take on new challenges, Disney may be the place for you. Being part of a driven and enthusiastic team on growing products, you will get to make a direct material impact on the future of The Walt Disney Company.

Responsibilities and Duties of the Role:

Ensure data integrity and accuracy through rigorous quality control processes

Analyze large and complex datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that inform strategic and tactical business decisions.

Design, develop, and maintain dashboards, comprehensive reports using data visualization tools

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and gather requirements that meet stakeholder needs.

Develop and implement efficient data models to support reporting and analytics needs, adhering to best practices and optimizing for query performance.

Implement automation solutions to streamline data integration processes, minimize manual intervention, and improve efficiency.

Communicate status, updates and project summaries via presentations, e-mail and direct communication with key collaborators and leadership.

Coordinate and lead regular meetings with regional partners to discuss data needs, insights, and updates

Excel at working with project partners to define project scope and objectives, and effectively communicate requirements to teams.

Monitor data-related projects, ensuring timely delivery and alignment with business objectives

Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and reporting and recommend and implement improvements

Required Qualifications and Experience:

BA/BS in communications, media, data analytics, computer sciences or related field required

3+ years of experience in digital TV/media-focused data analytics

Experience with, and a strong understanding of methodology, data and systems for matching data sets

Interest in data mining, analysis, and correlation, plus sharing the findings within the team and with strategic partners.

Ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment

Excellent communication skills and the ability to effectively present requirements, challenges, and solutions across internal and external teams and partners, plus effectively communicating complex concepts to technical and non-technical audiences.

Have excellent professional writing skills and can provide verbal explanations of status and technical issues with precision and accuracy.

Excel at working with project partners to define project scope and objectives, and effectively communicate requirements to development teams.

Strong presentation and documentation skills, including experience working with Confluence, PowerPoint, Airtable, ServiceNow and Keynote

Preferred Qualifications:

Relational database query experience, including writing/optimizing complex queries against distributed data stores such as Aurora, Hadoop, Hive, Oracle, and Snowflake

Experience or familiarity with creation of dashboards and data visualizations using: CloudWatch, NewRelic, Kibana, DataDog, Splunk, Grafana, and Conviva

Experience working with business intelligence tools such as MicroStrategy, Tableau, Business Objects, Looker, etc.

Knowledge of advanced statistical methods and machine learning techniques

The hiring range for this position in San Francisco, California is $76,600 - $102,700 per year and in New York, New York is $71,500 - $98,200 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.
